has joined #ccm 00:59 has joined #ccm 02:54 has joined #ccm 03:04 Hi marta 03:30 has joined #ccm 03:32 has joined #ccm 03:39 has joined #ccm 04:07 has joined #ccm 04:46 has joined #ccm 04:53 has joined #ccm 05:00 has joined #ccm 05:09 has joined #ccm 05:13 has joined #ccm 05:18 has joined #ccm 05:25 has joined #ccm 05:27 has joined #ccm 05:31 has joined #ccm 05:36 has joined #ccm 05:39 has joined #ccm 05:43 has joined #ccm 05:48 has joined #ccm 05:52 has joined #ccm 05:56 has joined #ccm 05:59 hey marta 06:01 has joined #ccm 06:26 has joined #ccm 06:51 has joined #ccm 07:11 has joined #ccm 07:12 can anyone tell me where should i post my idea for gsoc 2013?? 08:15 has joined #ccm 08:20 has joined #ccm 08:25 lakhan, Talk to mentors ,they should be available tomorrow 08:26 Decide on some idea 08:26 hello 08:26 ya tell me 08:26 Decide on some idea 08:26 And discuss it with mentors 08:26 in the mean time go through phenotips.org/community 08:27 There you would find some useful content 08:27 download the source code 08:27 and build it 08:27 If you need help let me know would help you as much as I can 08:27 or wait till tomorrow :) 08:27 okay 08:27 thnx for the help 08:28 First step for GSOC should be downloading and understanding the current codebase 08:28 vl u b available here all day?? 08:28 So do that 08:28 Mostly 08:28 okay 08:28 drop a message here 08:28 hw long r u working on the projects? 08:28 As in ? 08:29 means hw many months or weeks?? 08:29 i mean this project 08:30 Not long 08:30 2 weeks 08:31 oh so you know the code 08:31 Kind of not that much 08:31 What languages do you use ? 08:32 tel me once i fork this what shld i do nxt 08:32 from the github? 08:33 clone the code on your computer 08:33 Have you used git before ? 08:33 yup 08:35 Go through the build instructions 08:35 And build the code 08:35 Do you know Java ? 08:35 has joined #ccm 08:36 sdumitriu, Good morning :) 08:36 Hi 08:36 lakhan, in readme of github build instructions are given , try to build the code 08:39 sdumitriu, Help me I am stuck 08:39 OK, what's going on? 08:40 #__displayIfNotEmpty('indication_for_referral') Calls the display and label function 08:40 __label set the lable 08:40 and __display() for the field 08:40 ${doc.display($propName)} gives an input area i.e WYSIWYG box 08:41 I cant figure that out why 2 instances being displayed 08:41 OK, here's what's wrong 08:42 Every call to $doc.display(textarea property) registers a WYSIWYG instance for that field 08:42 Even if the output of $doc.display isn't printed 08:42 Does that help? 08:43 has joined #ccm 08:44 has joined #ccm 08:46 Ohh 08:46 has joined #ccm 08:50 has joined #ccm 08:51 sdumitriu, 08:51 Now I get it 08:52 So now it seems to be fixed 08:53 hello sir 08:53 Hi lakhan 08:53 sdumitriu, so this should be ok ? (% class="displayed-value"%)((( ${doc.display($propName)}))) 08:54 (% class="displayed-value"%)${doc.display($propName)}## 08:54 i wanted to work on a project :Mobile Web interface for PhenoTips 08:55 kushalkhandelwal: Nope, the #if must stay there, but the condition must be different 08:57 Sir i am new here 08:58 Hmm 08:58 @sdumitriu:can you guide me what should i do? 08:58 lakhan: OK, I've read your email 08:58 What case we are checking here ? 08:59 kushalkhandelwal: Same as __displayIfNotEmpty 08:59 sdumitriu:Thank you sir. 08:59 Don't call me sir 08:59 ok 09:00 the main thing is i was immobilized for past 4 months 09:00 and i just came across your project 09:00 and i would like to contibute in it 09:01 So, the first thing to do is to try and run the project 09:01 Get the sources, build, run, play with it 09:01 ok 09:01 So that you get a better idea of what PhenoTips does 09:02 I have forked the project from github 09:02 Then you have to start thinking about the project, like what do you think needs to be done, how, and how much time do you think that would take 09:02 Then start writing the application template 09:03 So we keep the same condition in display 09:03 Since the student registration opens tomorrow, you'll be able to apply already, and mentors can give further feedback so that you can improve the application 09:03 kushalkhandelwal: Yes 09:03 Check if we have the edit mode on 09:03 as in action is edit 09:03 else we display - 09:04 Why does every call register an instance of WYSIWYG ? 09:04 lakhan: To improve your chances of acceptance, you should stay on the IRC channel, and try to send a few pull requests 09:04 Like kushalkhandelwal is doing 09:04 :) 09:04 I guided him when you were not there 09:05 lakhan, You tried building the source ? 09:05 Yes, helping others is also a + 09:05 Yep , open source community :) 09:05 helping each other is a must I say 09:05 Indeed 09:06 Kushalkhandelwal: Yes I have forked it and i will try to play around with it 09:06 sdumitriu, Why does every call register an instance of WYSIWYG ? 09:06 Sdumitriu: Okay,I will do as you said 09:06 I went through the entire code today , case by case tried it 09:07 Was able to deduce what calls what 09:07 kushalkhandelwal: Since the WYSIWYG is rich in JavaScript, while most other types of fields just output some HTML, displaying a WYSIWYG field registers that a WYSIWYG instance should be activated 09:07 Ohh 09:07 has joined #ccm 09:08 Breakfast time, ttyl 09:09 Ok :) I will make a PR 09:12 has joined #ccm 09:23 has joined #ccm 09:29 has joined #ccm 09:33 has joined #ccm 09:36 has joined #ccm 09:37 has joined #ccm 09:40 has joined #ccm 09:46 has joined #ccm 09:49 has joined #ccm 10:00 has left #ccm 10:19 has joined #ccm 10:34 sdumitriu: there ? 10:34 Nope 10:35 :P 10:35 busy ? 10:35 I was just checking what the ---- looks like 10:35 It's good 10:35 :) 10:35 I was going through the code and the page 10:35 it looked cluttered so 10:35 a small fix 10:36 Yep 10:36 Anyway 10:36 You shouldn't mix different things in the same commit 10:36 Here's a trick: 10:37 git add --interactive 10:37 A small fix so added in the same 10:37 Hmm 10:37 Would keep a note of that next time. 10:38 (try git add --interactive when you actually have changes 10:38 if ("$!activeFields.contains('age_of_onset')" != 'false' Why we have this ? 10:38 Next time would try it for sure 10:41 It's because we want to be able to customize which fields are enabled for each installation 10:42 Not every hospital/research project need all those fields 10:42 Ohh 10:42 So some field would be common 10:43 Some would depend on hospital 10:43 So indication_for_referral would be optional ? 10:47 Yes 10:47 Click on the Administration link on the top left menu 10:48 Then choose Database and form configuration from the left 10:48 Here's where you can disable fields 10:49 Another tip: you can write #{else}-#{end} if you don't want extra whitespace in there 10:50 Hmm .. Ok 10:51 I had to put a space over there 10:52 Should i change it ? 10:52 Yes 11:04 if ("$!activeFields.contains('indication_for_referral')" != 'false' also ? 11:04 Probably not, let's ask marta 11:05 She says yes 11:05 So, yes it is 11:05 But 11:05 Don't commit in the same pull request 11:05 That's a different issue 11:07 Yes 11:07 would open a new issue for that 11:18 Corrected white space error 11:18 opened a new issue 11:18 Is the commit fit to merge ? 11:18 Perfect 11:19 Tell me one thing 11:20 i should merge this issue in my local repo master before the fix 11:20 ? 11:28 Sent PR 11:28 sdumitriu: 11:31 kushalk124: Yes 11:31 Opened a new issue 11:32 and sent a PR for that 11:32 I should have merged it ? 11:35 See my comment on the code 11:35 Oops a mistake 11:35 was copying the changes from repo 11:35 Wait 11:35 Copying how? 11:35 You'll learn 11:35 That's what GSoC is about 11:35 Copying as in 11:36 edited on the WebUI 11:36 and was putting in my editor 11:36 Need to learn a lot 11:36 I guess 11:38 has left #ccm 11:46 Issue #390 ? That is done ? 11:46 sdumitriu: 12:13 kushalk124: To merge upstream changes you need to do: 12:13 git remote add upstream https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips.git 12:13 (only once, to register the upstream repo) 12:13 git pull --rebase upstream 12:13 (every time when there are changes upstream) 12:15 #390 I think is done 12:15 I'm supposed to check that nothing is broken, but with so many students it's hard to find time for actual work... 12:16 The other issues, I'm working on them 12:17 So everytime i should rebase 12:17 Ohh 12:18 Will keep a track if I also find something broken 12:18 Which issues ? 12:18 https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/issues?milestone=5&state=open 12:18 I was also looking at the milestone also 12:19 I was supposed to release it yesterday, but it's been a very busy week... 12:19 Issue 375 12:19 Distribution wizard ? 12:19 Hehe 12:20 You done with the milestone ? 12:20 That's harder to fix since it requires changing stuff in XWiki 12:20 But I've fixed it locally, just have to push 12:20 What is Distribution wizard ? 12:20 Ohh nice :) 12:20 The distribution wizard is not something you should see often 12:21 It's triggered when upgrading between two stable versions 12:21 Like from 1.0-milestone-3 to 1.0-milestone-4 12:21 Ohh 12:22 Since the application itself and the actual wiki content are in two different places, upgrade means: 12:22 1. Upgrade the application files on the filesystem 12:22 2. Upgrade the contents of the database 12:23 2. is done by the distribution manager, which can do a 3-way merge between the previous version, the new version, and the actual file in the database 12:24 Hmm 12:24 Disribution manager is ? 12:24 Maven ? 12:24 Nope 12:24 http://localhost:8080/bin/distribution/XWiki/Distribution? 12:25 But it's going to be broken on your instance, since you're not actually upgrading anything 12:25 Yes it is broken 12:37 kushalk124: Did you start preparing the GSOC application? 12:37 Ah, I have a small issue 12:37 I have to had made a rough draft before 12:38 ? 12:39 https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/issues/397 12:41 I was looking at this one also https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/issues/187 12:49 Oh, #187 is big 12:50 Some minor improvements are possible 12:50 But the whole issue could be a whole GSoC project 12:50 Actually that's a good idea, I'll propose it 12:52 Ah, actually I was confusing it with another issue 12:52 #187 is doable 12:52 But it's still quite a lot of work, around a week for a novice 12:55 You were confusing with which idea ? 12:55 *issue 12:56 Can be done in parts 12:56 In the meantime 12:56 How would i edit the front page 12:56 ? 12:56 for issue 397 12:57 PhenoTips.DBWebHomeSheet 12:57 How to figure it out ? 12:58 http://localhost:8080/bin/WebHome?viewer=code 12:58 I'm sorry, but the fact that we've hidden the developer interface makes it really hard to... develop 12:59 We have to improve this really soon 12:59 Yep 12:59 Otherwise students will have a hard time doing stuff 12:59 You will have a hard time dealing with my pings all the time :P 13:00 Confusing with https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/issues/190 13:09 What does this do {{html wiki=false clean=false}} 13:10 It allows to embed HTML code in the output 13:10 Normally, any < and > will be printed as-is 13:10 So if you want to have a
, you need to wrap it in {{html}}...{{/html}} 13:11 Stuff in double curly brackets are macros 13:11 Like {{velocity}} which allows to execute Velocity code 13:11 Or {{warning}} which displays a warning 13:11 wiki=false means that the content doesn't contain any other wiki markup 13:11 wiki=false clean=false 13:11 ohh 13:12 So {{html wiki="true"}}This is bold, and so is **this**{{/html}} will print two bolds 13:12 But {{html wiki="false"}}This is bold, but **this** isn't{{/html}} will print only one, and actual **this** will be printed 13:13 clean controls whether the HTML code is cleaned or not 13:13 Meaning that you can write messy HTML inside, but the output will always be valid XHTML 13:13 Ohh nice 13:14 One more thing is it necessary to rebase 13:14 {{html clean="false"}}This is bold and italic{{/html} 13:14 gets cleaned as 13:14 This is bold and italic 13:14 becuase I am not able to do that with my network 13:15 Oh nice so it cleans the misformatted ones 13:15 But this is costly, so if you know the content is valid, you can skip the cleaning part 13:15 It costs in performance ? 13:15 It's not mandatory to rebase, but it's better 13:15 Yes, hurts performance 13:22 has joined #ccm 13:27 has joined #ccm 13:27 Sent PR 13:27 sorry net issue 13:28 sdumitriu, 13:28 hello, I have a question regarding the data included in the phenotip and relevant to comparing patients, please: it contains only clinical symptoms or it is related to measurements as well? 13:31 has joined #ccm 13:32 has joined #ccm 13:33 Hi camelia_ 13:35 has joined #ccm 13:39 has joined #ccm 13:40 has joined #ccm 13:43 has joined #ccm 13:43 I guess it's only the clinical symptoms, because the measurements are somehow comprised in the "growth parameters" physical findings 13:46 so the "clinical symptoms & physical findings" would be sufficient the comparison criteria among patients, plus age and sex. Are there any other criteria to be considered when establishing similar patients? 13:47 has joined #ccm 13:51 Sorry, phone call 13:51 has joined #ccm 13:53 Ok :) 13:53 camelia_: Indeed, the measurements are not that relevant on their own, since they're going to be reflected in the phenotypes 13:53 But in the future we'll have more data to take into account 13:54 Temporal data is something that's going to be very important 13:55 We already have some basic support for that, provided by the onset in the phenotype details 13:55 In that direction, the age of the measurements would be important as well 13:55 has joined #ccm 13:56 So the algorithms need to consider both three valued logic (True/False/Null) and numeric features 13:56 Yep 13:59 has joined #ccm 14:00 the onset is numeric, what is its meaning? 14:01 sdumitriu: Checked the PR ? 14:01 camelia_: Are you sure it's numeric? 14:03 kushalk124: Doing it now 14:03 has joined #ccm 14:04 let me check again 14:04 onset 8 integer Onset 14:05 Ah, yes, that's not used actually 14:05 It's deprecated 14:05 It's the next one, age_of_onset 14:06 which is a Database List 14:07 It allows to choose between a few HPO terms related to onset 14:07 has joined #ccm 14:07 If you edit a patient sheet and hover over each onset value, you'll see what they mean 14:08 kushalk124: Hehe, you needed two commits, again :) 14:09 Maybe next one will be better 14:09 Ya i noticed that white space :P 14:09 I was about to make a PR 14:09 than i notices something is wrong 14:09 :P 14:09 so opened the demo page and saw the mistake 14:09 Are you free ? 14:09 Yes 14:10 has joined #ccm 14:11 So any other bug ? 14:11 kushalk124: Want another one? 14:11 has joined #ccm 14:12 Yep 14:12 K, creating it 14:15 Creating it ? o.O 14:16 has joined #ccm 14:16 https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/issues/399 14:17 Let me know when you need a hint 14:19 To check that I understood it right: each time a patient visits the doctor a new Patient class instance is created. All instances related to a specific patient share the same patient id. Then we have an evolution of the patient's phenotip and diagnosis in time, at different exam dates. 14:20 has joined #ccm 14:20 Should we rely in diagnosis consistency in time, i.e. for the same one patient, if he/she had the same phenotip in subsequent visits, the diagnosis remained unaltered? 14:21 camelia_: We're not quite sure yet 14:21 Since the software is new, we don't have any repeat visits so far 14:22 But probably we're not going to create a new patient record, but branch a new visit for the same patient 14:22 We're recording the history of all changes done to the patient record 14:22 Hey sdumitriu 14:22 If you have time 14:22 we can try new PR i sent 14:23 But this history is linear, and there aren't any tags that mark when a new visit occurs 14:23 This is something that will be improved in the future 14:24 has joined #ccm 14:28 has joined #ccm 14:31 So all symptoms the patient ever had are put together in one Database List ? 14:32 Yes 14:32 has joined #ccm 14:36 has joined #ccm 14:36 And so are the diagnosis? I mean, if patient pac got diagnosis d1 and d2 on 1/04/2013 and then he went to another visit on 8/04/2013 and the doctor replaced diagnosis d2 with d3 for pac, then now pac has diagnosis d1 and d3 in the database. 14:36 Yes 14:38 so we're working with the last snapshot of the patient's data 14:38 Yes 14:38 ok, Thank You! 14:40 has joined #ccm 14:40 Good evening and see You tomorrow! 14:41 Bye camelia_ 14:44 has joined #ccm 14:48 has joined #ccm 14:52 has joined #ccm 14:57 has joined #ccm 15:01 has joined #ccm 15:02 has joined #ccm 15:05 has joined #ccm 15:05 has joined #ccm 15:09 has joined #ccm 15:09 has joined #ccm 15:13 has joined #ccm 15:13 has joined #ccm 15:14 Travis build timed out 15:15 Building PhenoTips for the first time takes a lot more than 10 minutes... 15:17 has joined #ccm 15:17 has joined #ccm 15:18 It didnt build 15:18 ? 15:18 Sorry was out 15:19 I cant find it on travis site 15:19 https://travis-ci.org/compbio-UofT/phenotips/jobs/6518913 15:20 Hmm 15:21 They have this local maven mirror 15:22 http://maven.mirrors.travis-ci.org/nexus/index.html 15:22 has joined #ccm 15:22 has joined #ccm 15:22 I think we have to configure it to use this 15:22 For some repositories 15:23 Will raise a support ticket for this 15:24 Can you join #travis 15:26 has joined #ccm 15:26 has joined #ccm 15:28 sdumitriu: ? 15:30 has joined #ccm 15:30 has joined #ccm 15:31 kushalk124: Ye 15:31 p 15:33 He replied only once 15:33 No support ! 15:33 Will try to tweak it somehow 15:34 There should be a way 15:34 How much time does it take on jenkins ? 15:34 has joined #ccm 15:34 has joined #ccm 15:34 16 minutes 15:35 But that's not the problem 15:35 The first part is "fetch all dependencies" 15:35 And they assume that it shouldn't take more than 10 minutes to do that 15:35 But we have a lot of dependencies, and a few big ones 15:36 So it's going to take a while 15:36 Hmm 15:36 I'll try to commit that 15:37 I opened a PR 15:39 K 15:40 If build time out is 50 mins 15:40 it should work 15:40 has joined #ccm 15:40 has joined #ccm 15:40 Yeah, read that 15:41 Lets try it 15:41 Waiting for the build result 15:41 And I was reproducing the bug 15:41 It's nice that pull requests now have Travis integrated 15:41 I already see it building 15:41 Yes thats the best part of travis 15:41 https://travis-ci.org/compbio-UofT/phenotips/jobs/6519947 15:42 Without merge we can check :) 15:44 has joined #ccm 15:44 has joined #ccm 15:49 has joined #ccm 15:49 has joined #ccm 15:51 It seems to be working fine now 15:52 sdumitriu: 15:52 What do you mean by homepage is read only ? 15:52 for the bug 15:52 There are steps to reproduce 15:53 That I reproduced 15:53 It means that normal users can't edit it 15:53 Only administrators 15:54 If i remove the last commit i.e $hasedit 15:54 than it can 15:54 normal users dont have edit allowed ? 15:55 They do y default 15:55 They do by default 15:55 Again, the normal interface is hidden 15:56 But they can access http://localhost:8080/bin/edit/data/WebHome 15:56 I cant access after reproducing it 16:00 has joined #ccm 16:00 has joined #ccm 16:00 Build failed :\ 16:00 sdumitriu: 16:02 We have some way out ? 16:08 kushalk124: You should /join #phenotips as well 16:08 I wonder why the IRC notifications don't work 16:09 Hmm 16:09 they should have worked 16:11 We get jenkins build status on #phenotips ? 16:11 Jenkins, no, I didn't configure it 16:11 But that's a good idea, I should look into it 16:12 But anyway, that's where PhenoTips discussions should take place 16:12 Ohh 16:12 :P 16:17 has joined #ccm 16:17 [travis-ci] compbio-UofT/phenotips (master:33d8fb1 by Sergiu Dumitriu): The build has errored. (http://travis-ci.org/compbio-UofT/phenotips/builds/6520353) 16:17 has left #ccm 16:17 There you go, we got a notification 16:17 :) 16:17 What was the error ? 16:18 Why did it fail again ? 16:19 Ah, that's normal 16:20 It's on master, before the install: change 16:22 [travis-ci] compbio-UofT/phenotips (master:bbcb6f1 by Sergiu Dumitriu): The build has errored. (http://travis-ci.org/compbio-UofT/phenotips/builds/6520541) 16:25 Late night hunger pangs :D 16:25 I need to find something to eat :P 18:31 has joined #ccm 23:14 has joined #ccm
